description: {"blocks":[{"key":"90nna","text":"This protocol is designed for RNA slide preparation for formalin-fixed tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs7nr","text":"The steps of the protocol are from Nanostring MAN-10150-03 June 23 version.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35g0h","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"18je1","text":"IMPORTANT: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uk0s","text":"Take care to maintain nuclease-free conditions. The most significant risk of contamination comes from GeoMx probes and other oligos. We recommend the use of RNase AWAY (Thermo Fisher 7002) for cleaning of all surfaces and equipment, as
it will limit contamination from oligos, GeoMxprobes and nucleases. After using RNase AWAY, allow area/items to air dry completely, or rinse with DEPC-treated water. See manufacturer's instructions for details.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":169,"length":6},{"key":1,"offset":176,"length":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"929hf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed3s2","text":"If sections are too large and/or placed off-center, continue with slide preparation as usual. Just before loading the
slide in the instrument slide tray, scrape off the parts of the tissue exceeding the scan area, ensuring the slide gasket and tip calibration area are tissue-free. Scraping off tissue before slide preparation could generate tissue folds that may result in staining or binding artifacts.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clfst","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt6pl","text":"
Selecting and Sectioning FFPE Samples
","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"era30","text":" When preparing, sectioning, and storing FFPE blocks for use in the GeoMx DSP Proteinand RNA assays, take care to preserve sample integrity at all steps. The integrity of FFPE samples is impacted
by many factors including time from excision to fixation, storage conditions,
tissue type, and sample age. Samples with poor integrity are likely to give low
signal, particularly in RNA assays.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecoe3","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qgoa","text":"GeoMx has been validated for sample blocks up to 3 years old prepared from tissues with a cold ischemic
time of less than 1 hour using 10% NBF or similar fixative. For best results, do not use FFPE blocks more than 10 years old. Assay performance will be influenced by tissue blockage and treatment conditions such as cold/warm ischemic time, fixative, and storage.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"358nr","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vmu7","text":"Selecting FFPE blocks
 
FFPE blocks should meet the following criteria for the best performance with GeoMx DSP assays.

1. Blocks should be fixed in 10% neutral buffered formalin for 18 to 24 hours at room temperature. This applies to tissues less than 0.5 cm in thickness. Larger tissues have not been tested by NanoString and may require longer fixation times.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4nps","text":"
 2.    Tissues should be fixed immediately after excision for best results. Fixation within one hour post-excision is acceptable","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fsfh","text":".
 3. Tissues should be thoroughly dehydrated in ethanol gradients prior to embedding in paraffin.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8c84","text":"
 4. FFPE blocks should be stored at room temperature and ambient humidity.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qbec","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k2qm","text":" 5. For best results, do not use FFPE blocks that are more than 10 years old.


Sectioning FFPE blocks
","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":80,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3memc","text":" The following are general guidelines for sectioning FFPE blocks for optimal GeoMx DSP assay performance. This is not meant to be an all- inclusive guide on sectioning. Please refer to your local pathologist or core facility for training on sectioning.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctr0l","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2tvl","text":"Due to oxidation at the surface, discard the first few sections cut from the block face.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vf2h","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vmom","text":"NanoString recommends SuperFrost™ Plus slides (for manual slide preparation) or Apex BOND® or
BOND Plus slides (for BOND automated slide preparation or manual slide preparation for tissues that exhibit poor adhesion).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1giq","text":"
FFPE tissue sections should be cut 5 µm thick on a calibrated microtome and mounted on the slide immediately, without scratches or folds.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a6nd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o23t","text":"
Tissue sections must be placed in the Scan Area (shown in green in  Figure 1) in the center of the slide and be no
larger than 35.3 mm long by 14.1 mm wide.They should not overlap the slide gasket(shown in blue)or the tip calibration area (shown in red). If mounting multiple sections per slide, ensure that tissues are at least 2–3 mm apart and still fit within the ScanArea.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":113,"length":43},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":69,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"ff7q5","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vjmh","text":" 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"mnln","text":" Any water trapped under the wax or tissue section should be removed by gently touching a folded Kimwipe to the corner of the wax section. The Kimwipe should not contact the tissue.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3prgo","text":" Air dry mounted slides overnight prior to use. Store slides in a vertical position such that any remaining water can drain away from the tissue section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5gur","text":"
Slides stored in a desiccator (or in a sealed container with a desiccant pouch)at 4°C or room temperature have been shown to yield quality results for up to 3 months. Quality of results is tissue and block-dependent and should be tested
empirically.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nviq","text":"

Use DEPC- treated water for all dilutions. The actual volume of reagents used in the protocol will vary – the volumes to prepare in Table 1 are suggestions.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":13},{"key":1,"offset":200,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"778kq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"607r4","text":"Table 1: Reagent prep for RNA slide preparation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18v21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfoia","text":" Reagent Dilution Storage 95% EtOH Prepare 500 mL of 95% ethanol by adding 25 mL of DEPC-treated water to 475 mL of 100% ethanol. NanoString recommends to prepare fresh each week. RT 1X PBS pH 7.4 Prepare 1 L of 1X PBS by combining 100 mL of 10X PBS and 900 mL of DEPC- treated water. Do not reuse. RT Proteinase K Default concentration (1 µg/mL) is made by adding 10 μL of 20 mg/mL Proteinase K to 200 mL of 1X PBS made with DEPC-treated water. See Table 2 for alternative concentrations by tissue type. Note: Prepare fresh and do not reuse. Take care to pipette accurately. Inaccurate concentration of Proteinase K will affect assay performance. n/a NBF stop buffer Add 6.06 g tris base and 3.75 g glycine to 5 L DEPC-treated water to yield 0.1 M tris, 0.1 M glycine. Store at RT up to 1 month. RT 2X SSC Prepare 1 L of 2X SSC by combining 100 mL of 20X SSC and 900 mL of DEPC-treated water. RT 2X SSC-T (optional) Prepare 250 mL of 2X SSC-T by combining 25 mL of 20X SSC, 2.5 mL of 10%Tween20, and 222.5 mL of DEPC-treated water. RT 4X SSC Prepare 1 L of 4X SSC by combining 200 mL of 20X SSC and 800 mL of DEPC-treated water. RT 1X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 (antigen retrieval solution) Prepare 1 L of 1X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 by combining 100 mL of 10X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 and 900 mL of DEPC-treated water. "," RT "],[" 2X SSC-T (optional) "," Prepare 250 mL of 2X SSC-T by combining 25 mL of 20X SSC, 2.5 mL of 10%Tween20, and 222.5 mL of DEPC-treated water. "," RT "],[" 4X SSC "," Prepare 1 L of 4X SSC by combining 200 mL of 20X SSC and 800 mL of DEPC-treated water. "," RT "],[" 1X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 (antigen retrieval solution) "," Prepare 1 L of 1X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 by combining 100 mL of 10X Tris-EDTA pH 9.0 and 900 mL of DEPC-treated water. "," RT "]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"pque","text":"Bake slides with mounted sections in a 60°C drying oven for 30 minutes to 3 hours prior to deparaffinization. Stand slides vertically during baking to allow excess paraffin to flow off. Longer baking times may be necessary for some tissues to sufficiently adhere to the slide (e.g., overnight at 37°C followed by 2-4 hr at 60°C); this should be empirically tested. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eqe7","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Deparaffinize and rehydrate FFPE tissue sections (31 minutes),
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fv8qi","text":"The steamer, staining jars, 1X Tris- EDTA (pH 9.0) (antigen retrieval solution), DEPC- treated water, water bath and Proteinase K solution are preheated here for their use in a later step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":47},{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":117,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qsq8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9euu","text":"(To prepare cell pellet samples, use a hot plate set to 85°C, rather than the steamer). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2us2n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"345v6","text":"Fill the steamer reservoir up to the fill line with water. Place two staining jars inside, one containing DEPC-treated water and one containing 1X Tris-EDTA (pH 9.0) (Antigen Retrieval Solution). Ensure sufficient reagent volume to cover slides up to the label. Loosely cover each jar with aluminum foil instead of the jar lid to allow for a thermometer reading in a later step. Preheat the steamer to 100°C. More water may need to be added to the steamer during preheating. Check on the steamer every 30 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":106,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":144,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":262,"length":115},{"style":"bold","offset":379,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":496,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n3p9","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59ebt","text":"The Nesco steamer takes 1 hour to heat the liquid in the jars to a stable maximum temperature near 100°C. {"blocks":[{"key":"7egev","text":"\nPost-fix the tissue by performing these washes (see Figure 3):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uss5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a2nv","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c5pip","text":"Slides can be stored in the final 1X PBS wash up to 1 hour at room temperature or 6 hours at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":96}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd5mc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rp9d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pk9c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"09B9273942AB11EE82EA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark37"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":115,"id":399772,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1qq8b\",\"text\":\"Figure 3: Post-fix wash steps\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngn8b53ax.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngn6b53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngn7b53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngn5b53ax.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qcm","text":"Needed for this step: hybridization chamber, hybridization oven, Buffer R, RNA Probe Mix, and 2X SSC or DEPC-treated water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":68},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ed7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8k04","text":"IMPORTANT:\nProbe mixes should be handled in an area separate from nCounter work, NGS library prep, or other GeoMx workflows. GeoMx detection reagents can cross-contaminate probe mixes and give misleading or incorrect results. Areas should be cleaned thoroughly with RNase AWAY after probe mix formulation. Alternatively, handle probe mixes in PCR workstations decontaminated with UV light. Change gloves after handling any probe mixes to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":124}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f4cr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gmpc","text":"Due to the high sensitivity of this assay, it is recommended that you change pipette filter tips for every step, change gloves frequently, and use fresh wipes to remove excess liquids.\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acjdf","text":"Prepare reagents: Warm Buffer R and RNA detection probes to room temperature before opening. (Warming RNA detection probes reduces viscosity, improving pipetting accuracy.) Before use, flick to mix, then spin down. Store unused RNA detection probes at 4°C for up to 6 months or re-freeze.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":216,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t2tk","text":"Clean the hybridization chamber and other equipment with RNase AWAY and allow to dry, or rinse with DEPC- treated water. The hybridization chamber can be a key source of contamination by oligos. Arrange fresh Kimwipes on the bottom of the chamber and wet with 2X SSC or DEPC- treated water. Kimwipes should be thoroughly damp, but the liquid should not pool. If your chamber is light permeable, wrap the lid in aluminum foil to minimize light exposure.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4r1a","text":"One at a time, remove slides from 1X PBS, wipe away excess liquid, and set in a hybridization chamber in a horizontal position. Take care not to let the slides dry out.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42},{"style":"bold","offset":128,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8f7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c26ph","text":"Ensure that the Kimwipes and liquid do not contact the slides. Hybridization solution can wick off of the slides if it comes into contact with Kimwipes or liquid. \n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bsj6","text":" Add 200 μL hybridization solution to each slide. Take care not to introduce any bubbles.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5cor","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fj11","text":"To avoid bubbles, leave a small residual volume in the pipette tip. If a bubble forms, aspirate it gently with the pipette. Do not touch the tissue with the tip. It is preferable to lose some hybridization solution and remove bubbles than to have bubbles in the solution as long as sufficient solution remains to cover the tissue after the coverslip is applied.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t1bp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqhdo","text":"IMPORTANT: From this point on, minimize the slides' exposure to light to preserve the integrity of the photocleavable barcodes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i0j5","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lv78","text":"Gently apply a Grace Bio-Labs HybriSlip\nStart by setting one edge of the coverslipdown in solution on the slide, then gradually laying down the rest of the coverslipto avoid the formation of air bubbles (see Figure 4).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":203,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"8gk81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2aaf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4CE6D3FF42AE11EE82EA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark40"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":214,"id":399776,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"fthtt\",\"text\":\"Figure 4: Applying coverslip\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngpcb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngpab53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngpbb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngn9b53ax.webp","width":352}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8u4n","text":"Repeat steps 4–7 for each slide.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfjvm","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22p0j","text":"GeoMx RNA assay slides are reusable and can be restained with a different commercial or custom panel following this procedure. This procedure requires a UV light box or transilluminator capable of emitting 302/312 nm UV light (example), 2X SSC-T, 1X Tris-EDTA, and 2X SSC.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":227,"length":7}],"data":{}},{"key":"72gos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D3C9407542B411EE82EA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/browse/90222053/Transilluminators"}}}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cv8tb","text":" Place the slide flat on the surface of a UV transilluminator.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7bam","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2sd1r","text":"Apply enough 2X SSC-T to completely cover the tissue (50–200μL depending on the size of the tissue).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42ngt","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"98rvf","text":"Expose to UV light for 3 minutes to cleave tags from bound probes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1sh3i","text":"Carefully tap each slide on a clean, disposable surface (e.g., paper towel) to remove liquid and avoid oligo contamination.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"drja5","text":"Wash slides by dipping in a staining jar with 2X SSC-T.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ftv","text":"Transfer to another staining jar with fresh 2X SSC-T.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90t3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"92om0","text":"Incubate the slides in 1X Tris- EDTA at 85°C using either a hotplate or a pressure cooker on a low\npressure setting for 15 minutes.\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Stripping and re-probing procedure for RNA slides
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5udsq","text":"Wash 3 times in 2X SSC.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Load slides onto the GeoMx DSP following the GeoMx DSP Instrument User Manual (MAN-10152).
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a0akf","text":"Follow instruction from User Manual ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5nrd2","text":"Tissue sections should be 5 µm thick and mounted on Superfrost Plus or BOND Plus slides. Tissue sections must be placed in the Scan Area (shown in green in Figure 3) in the center of the slide and be no larger than 35.3 mm long by 14.1 mm wide. Mounted material should not overlap the slide gasket (shown in blue) or the tip calibration area (shown in red). If mounting multiple sections per slide, ensure that tissues are at least 2–3 mm apart and still fit within the Scan Area.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":127,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":200,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":156,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"89vsv","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"k8mg","text":"If sections are too large and/or placed off-center, continue with slide preparation as usual. Just before loading the slide in the instrument slide tray, scrape off the parts of the tissue exceeding the scan area, ensuring the slide gasket and tip calibration area are tissue-free. Scraping off tissue before slide preparation could generate tissue folds that may result in staining or binding artifacts.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dc0k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v3oo","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"58F7CF5D42D511EE9BBF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark14"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":258,"id":399808,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"26lf8\",\"text\":\"Figure 3: Slide dimensions. Measure from labeledge of slide as reference point.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqcb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqab53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqbb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngp9b53ax.webp","width":462}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":55,"id":399812,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqgb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqeb53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqfb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqdb53ax.webp","width":475}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26bmv","text":"Bake slides with mounted sections in a 60°C drying oven for 30 minutes to 3 hours prior to deparaffinization. Stand slides vertically during baking to allow excess paraffin to flow off. Longer baking times may be necessary for some tissues to sufficiently adhere to the slide (e.g., overnight\nat 37°C followed by 2-4 hr at 60°C); this should be empirically tested.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ktoj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsmcv","text":"Once the 1X Tris-EDTA reaches 99°C, carefully remove the steamer lid, pressure cooker lid, and jar covers. Dip the slides into the DEPC-treated water for 10 seconds to bring the slide temperature up to ~99°C. Quickly transfer the slides to the 1X Tris-EDTA. Replace jar cover, then replace steamer/ pressure cooker lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":131,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":154,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":244,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87nnj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gacl","text":"If using a pressure cooker, ensure that the pressure valve is open and the temperature of the pressure cooker is above 110°C. Once the pressure is fully release, open the pressure cooker and Dip the slides into the DEPC-treated water for 10 seconds to bring the slide temperature up to ~99°C. Quickly transfer the slides to the 1X Tris-EDTA. Replace jar cover, then replace steamer/ pressure cooker lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":215,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":238,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":328,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebtua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m5dr","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":71,"id":399816,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqkb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqib53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqjb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqhb53ax.webp","width":464}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aqta6","text":"Incubate the slides according to the conditions for different tissue types in Table 2. Incubation times and temperatures may need to be empirically determined. If the tissue type you wish to use is not listed, start with 15 minutes in your empirical testing.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"2g1h5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k92r","text":"Epitope retrieval times were determined based on FFPE tissue blocks meeting the constraints outlined in the sample guidance section. Samples were primarily tumor with minimal normal adjacent tissue. These conditions may vary by sample,the amount of normal adjacent tissue, and other factors. These conditions were optimized for large tumor sections and may not apply to arrayed tissues, cored tissues, and needle biopsies.\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"709CF05242D611EE9BBF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark35"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dfql","text":"When target retrieval time is up, move slides to room temperature 1X PBS immediately. \nWash in room temperature 1X PBS for 5 minutes. Slides can be stored forup to 1 hour in 1X PBS\n","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":52},{"style":"bold","offset":87,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqois","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":128,"id":399820,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqqb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqnb53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqpb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqmb53ax.webp","width":142}}}}

steps.section: Deparaffinize and rehydrate FFPE tissue sections (31 minutes),
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdt5i","text":"Deparaffinize and rehydrate FFPE tissue sections. Place slides in a rack and perform the  following washes in stainingjars (see Figure 2). Ensureyou have sufficient buffer volume to cover all slides. Slides should be dipped up and down gently several times when placing in and before removing from staining jars. Afterthe last wash,slides can be stored in the 1X PBS for up to one hour.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":123,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"b7nc8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84csu","text":"  During wash steps, preheat the water bath to 37°C. Prepare the Proteinase K dilution, if not yet done, and add the diluted Proteinase K solution to a staining jar and place in the water bath\nto preheat to 37°C. Refer to Table 2for the recommended Proteinase K concentration for your tissue type.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":109,"length":102},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":228,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":1,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":222,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"1nfc8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E10347CD42DD11EE9BBF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark32"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":75,"id":399824,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9027l\",\"text\":\"Figure 2: Wash steps\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqub53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqsb53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqtb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqrb53ax.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":23,"id":399828,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqyb53ax.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqwb53ax.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqxb53ax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ngqvb53ax.webp","width":474}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"577EF5A942DE11EE9BBF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"#_bookmark35"}}}}
